members.name: OPEN_DIALOG
members.comment: Type value indicating that the JFileChooser supports an "Open" file operation.

members.name: SAVE_DIALOG
members.comment: Type value indicating that the JFileChooser supports a "Save" file operation.

members.name: CUSTOM_DIALOG
members.comment: Type value indicating that the JFileChooser supports a developer-specified file operation.

members.name: CANCEL_OPTION
members.comment: Return value if cancel is chosen.

members.name: APPROVE_OPTION
members.comment: Return value if approve (yes, ok) is chosen.

members.name: ERROR_OPTION
members.comment: Return value if an error occurred.

members.name: FILES_ONLY
members.comment: Instruction to display only files.

members.name: DIRECTORIES_ONLY
members.comment: Instruction to display only directories.

members.name: FILES_AND_DIRECTORIES
members.comment: Instruction to display both files and directories.

members.name: CANCEL_SELECTION
members.comment: Instruction to cancel the current selection.

members.name: APPROVE_SELECTION
members.comment: Instruction to approve the current selection (same as pressing yes or ok).

members.name: APPROVE_BUTTON_TEXT_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Identifies change in the text on the approve (yes, ok) button.

members.name: APPROVE_BUTTON_TOOL_TIP_TEXT_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Identifies change in the tooltip text for the approve (yes, ok) button.

members.name: APPROVE_BUTTON_MNEMONIC_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Identifies change in the mnemonic for the approve (yes, ok) button.

members.name: CONTROL_BUTTONS_ARE_SHOWN_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Instruction to display the control buttons.

members.name: DIRECTORY_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Identifies user's directory change.

members.name: SELECTED_FILE_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Identifies change in user's single-file selection.

members.name: SELECTED_FILES_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Identifies change in user's multiple-file selection.

members.name: MULTI_SELECTION_ENABLED_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Enables multiple-file selections.

members.name: FILE_SYSTEM_VIEW_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Says that a different object is being used to find available drives on the system.

members.name: FILE_VIEW_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Says that a different object is being used to retrieve file information.

members.name: FILE_HIDING_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Identifies a change in the display-hidden-files property.

members.name: FILE_FILTER_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: User changed the kind of files to display.

members.name: FILE_SELECTION_MODE_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Identifies a change in the kind of selection (single, multiple, etc.).

members.name: ACCESSORY_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Says that a different accessory component is in use (for example, to preview files).

members.name: ACCEPT_ALL_FILE_FILTER_USED_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Identifies whether a the AcceptAllFileFilter is used or not.

members.name: DIALOG_TITLE_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Identifies a change in the dialog title.

members.name: DIALOG_TYPE_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Identifies a change in the type of files displayed (files only, directories only, or both files and directories).

members.name: CHOOSABLE_FILE_FILTER_CHANGED_PROPERTY
members.comment: Identifies a change in the list of predefined file filters the user can choose from.

members.name: accessibleContext
members.comment: AccessibleContext associated with this JFileChooser

members.name: setup
members.comment: Performs common constructor initialization and setup.

param: view - the FileSystemView used for setup

members.name: setDragEnabled
members.comment: Sets the dragEnabled property, which must be true to enable automatic drag handling (the first part of drag and drop) on this component. The transferHandler property needs to be set to a non-null value for the drag to do anything. The default value of the dragEnabled property is false. When automatic drag handling is enabled, most look and feels begin a drag-and-drop operation whenever the user presses the mouse button over an item and then moves the mouse a few pixels. Setting this property to true can therefore have a subtle effect on how selections behave. Some look and feels might not support automatic drag and drop; they will ignore this property. You can work around such look and feels by modifying the component to directly call the exportAsDrag method of a TransferHandler.

values.name: escription
values.value: determines whether automatic drag handling is enabled

param: b - the value to set the dragEnabled property to
throws: HeadlessException - if b is true and GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless() returns true

members.name: getDragEnabled
members.comment: Gets the value of the dragEnabled property.

return: the value of the dragEnabled property

members.name: getSelectedFile
members.comment: Returns the selected file. This can be set either by the programmer via setSelectedFile or by a user action, such as either typing the filename into the UI or selecting the file from a list in the UI.

return: the selected file

members.name: setSelectedFile
members.comment: Sets the selected file. If the file's parent directory is not the current directory, changes the current directory to be the file's parent directory.

param: file - the selected file

members.name: getSelectedFiles
members.comment: Returns a list of selected files if the file chooser is set to allow multiple selection.

return: an array of selected Files

members.name: setSelectedFiles
members.comment: Sets the list of selected files if the file chooser is set to allow multiple selection.

values.name: escription
values.value: The list of selected files if the chooser is in multiple selection mode.

param: selectedFiles - an array Files to be selected

members.name: getCurrentDirectory
members.comment: Returns the current directory.

return: the current directory

members.name: setCurrentDirectory
members.comment: Sets the current directory. Passing in null sets the file chooser to point to the user's default directory. This default depends on the operating system. It is typically the "My Documents" folder on Windows, and the user's home directory on Unix. If the file passed in as currentDirectory is not a directory, the parent of the file will be used as the currentDirectory. If the parent is not traversable, then it will walk up the parent tree until it finds a traversable directory, or hits the root of the file system.

values.name: escription
values.value: The directory that the JFileChooser is showing files of.

param: dir - the current directory to point to

members.name: changeToParentDirectory
members.comment: Changes the directory to be set to the parent of the current directory.

members.name: rescanCurrentDirectory
members.comment: Tells the UI to rescan its files list from the current directory.

members.name: ensureFileIsVisible
members.comment: Makes sure that the specified file is viewable, and not hidden.

param: f - a File object

members.name: showOpenDialog
members.comment: Pops up an "Open File" file chooser dialog. Note that the text that appears in the approve button is determined by the L&F.

param: parent - the parent component of the dialog, can be null; see showDialog for details
throws: HeadlessException - if GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless() returns true.
return:
the return state of the file chooser on popdown:
  • JFileChooser.CANCEL_OPTION
  • JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION
  • JFileChooser.ERROR_OPTION if an error occurs or the dialog is dismissed

members.name: showSaveDialog
members.comment: Pops up a "Save File" file chooser dialog. Note that the text that appears in the approve button is determined by the L&F.

param: parent - the parent component of the dialog, can be null; see showDialog for details
throws: HeadlessException - if GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless() returns true.
return:
the return state of the file chooser on popdown:
  • JFileChooser.CANCEL_OPTION
  • JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION
  • JFileChooser.ERROR_OPTION if an error occurs or the dialog is dismissed

members.name: showDialog

param: parent - the parent component of the dialog; can be null
approveButtonText - the text of the ApproveButton
throws: HeadlessException - if GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless() returns true.
return:
the return state of the file chooser on popdown:
  • JFileChooser.CANCEL_OPTION
  • JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION
  • JFileChooser.ERROR_OPTION if an error occurs or the dialog is dismissed

members.name: createDialog

param: parent - the parent component of the dialog; can be null
throws: HeadlessException - if GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless() returns true.
return: a new JDialog containing this instance

members.name: getControlButtonsAreShown
members.comment: Returns the value of the controlButtonsAreShown property.

return: the value of the controlButtonsAreShown property

members.name: setControlButtonsAreShown
members.comment: Sets the property that indicates whether the approve and cancel buttons are shown in the file chooser. This property is true by default. Look and feels that always show these buttons will ignore the value of this property. This method fires a property-changed event, using the string value of CONTROL_BUTTONS_ARE_SHOWN_CHANGED_PROPERTY as the name of the property.

values.name: escription
values.value: Sets whether the approve & cancel buttons are shown.

param: b - false if control buttons should not be shown; otherwise, true

members.name: getDialogType
members.comment: Returns the type of this dialog. The default is JFileChooser.OPEN_DIALOG.

return:
the type of dialog to be displayed:
  • JFileChooser.OPEN_DIALOG
  • JFileChooser.SAVE_DIALOG
  • JFileChooser.CUSTOM_DIALOG

members.name: setDialogType
members.comment: Sets the type of this dialog. Use OPEN_DIALOG when you want to bring up a file chooser that the user can use to open a file. Likewise, use SAVE_DIALOG for letting the user choose a file for saving. Use CUSTOM_DIALOG when you want to use the file chooser in a context other than "Open" or "Save". For instance, you might want to bring up a file chooser that allows the user to choose a file to execute. Note that you normally would not need to set the JFileChooser to use CUSTOM_DIALOG since a call to setApproveButtonText does this for you. The default dialog type is JFileChooser.OPEN_DIALOG.

values.name: escription
values.value: The type (open, save, custom) of the JFileChooser.

param:
dialogType - the type of dialog to be displayed:
  • JFileChooser.OPEN_DIALOG
  • JFileChooser.SAVE_DIALOG
  • JFileChooser.CUSTOM_DIALOG
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if dialogType is not legal

members.name: setDialogTitle
members.comment: Sets the string that goes in the JFileChooser window's title bar.

values.name: escription
values.value: The title of the JFileChooser dialog window.

param: dialogTitle - the new String for the title bar

members.name: getDialogTitle
members.comment: Gets the string that goes in the JFileChooser's titlebar.

return: the string from the JFileChooser window's title bar

members.name: setApproveButtonToolTipText
members.comment: Sets the tooltip text used in the ApproveButton. If null, the UI object will determine the button's text.

values.name: escription
values.value: The tooltip text for the ApproveButton.

param: toolTipText - the tooltip text for the approve button

members.name: getApproveButtonToolTipText
members.comment: Returns the tooltip text used in the ApproveButton. If null, the UI object will determine the button's text.

return: the tooltip text used for the approve button

members.name: getApproveButtonMnemonic
members.comment: Returns the approve button's mnemonic.

return: an integer value for the mnemonic key

members.name: setApproveButtonMnemonic
members.comment: Sets the approve button's mnemonic using a numeric keycode.

values.name: escription
values.value: The mnemonic key accelerator for the ApproveButton.

param: mnemonic - an integer value for the mnemonic key

members.name: setApproveButtonMnemonic
members.comment: Sets the approve button's mnemonic using a character.

param: mnemonic - a character value for the mnemonic key

members.name: setApproveButtonText
members.comment: Sets the text used in the ApproveButton in the FileChooserUI.

values.name: escription
values.value: The text that goes in the ApproveButton.

param: approveButtonText - the text used in the ApproveButton

members.name: getApproveButtonText
members.comment: Returns the text used in the ApproveButton in the FileChooserUI. If null, the UI object will determine the button's text. Typically, this would be "Open" or "Save".

return: the text used in the ApproveButton

members.name: getChoosableFileFilters
members.comment: Gets the list of user choosable file filters.

return: a FileFilter array containing all the choosable file filters

members.name: addChoosableFileFilter
members.comment: Adds a filter to the list of user choosable file filters. For information on setting the file selection mode, see setFileSelectionMode.

values.name: escription
values.value: Adds a filter to the list of user choosable file filters.

param: filter - the FileFilter to add to the choosable file filter list

members.name: removeChoosableFileFilter
members.comment: Removes a filter from the list of user choosable file filters. Returns true if the file filter was removed.

param: f - the file filter to be removed
return: true if the file filter was removed, false otherwise

members.name: resetChoosableFileFilters
members.comment: Resets the choosable file filter list to its starting state. Normally, this removes all added file filters while leaving the AcceptAll file filter.

members.name: getAcceptAllFileFilter
members.comment: Returns the AcceptAll file filter. For example, on Microsoft Windows this would be All Files (*.*).

return: the AcceptAll file filter

members.name: isAcceptAllFileFilterUsed
members.comment: Returns whether the AcceptAll FileFilter is used.

return: true if the AcceptAll FileFilter is used

members.name: setAcceptAllFileFilterUsed
members.comment: Determines whether the AcceptAll FileFilter is used as an available choice in the choosable filter list. If false, the AcceptAll file filter is removed from the list of available file filters. If true, the AcceptAll file filter will become the actively used file filter.

values.name: escription
values.value: Sets whether the AcceptAll FileFilter is used as an available choice in the choosable filter list.

param: b - a boolean which determines whether the AcceptAll file filter is an available choice in the choosable filter list

members.name: getAccessory
members.comment: Returns the accessory component.

return: this JFileChooser's accessory component, or null

members.name: setAccessory
members.comment: Sets the accessory component. An accessory is often used to show a preview image of the selected file; however, it can be used for anything that the programmer wishes, such as extra custom file chooser controls. Note: if there was a previous accessory, you should unregister any listeners that the accessory might have registered with the file chooser.

values.name: escription
values.value: Sets the accessory component on the JFileChooser.

param: newAccessory - the accessory component to be set

members.name: setFileSelectionMode
members.comment: Sets the JFileChooser to allow the user to just select files, just select directories, or select both files and directories. The default is JFilesChooser.FILES_ONLY.

values.name: escription
values.value: Sets the types of files that the JFileChooser can choose.

param:
mode - the type of files to be displayed:
  • JFileChooser.FILES_ONLY
  • JFileChooser.DIRECTORIES_ONLY
  • JFileChooser.FILES_AND_DIRECTORIES
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if mode is an illegal file selection mode

members.name: getFileSelectionMode
members.comment: Returns the current file-selection mode. The default is JFilesChooser.FILES_ONLY.

return:
the type of files to be displayed, one of the following:
  • JFileChooser.FILES_ONLY
  • JFileChooser.DIRECTORIES_ONLY
  • JFileChooser.FILES_AND_DIRECTORIES

members.name: isFileSelectionEnabled
members.comment: Convenience call that determines if files are selectable based on the current file selection mode.

return: true if files are selectable, false otherwise

members.name: isDirectorySelectionEnabled
members.comment: Convenience call that determines if directories are selectable based on the current file selection mode.

return: true if directories are selectable, false otherwise

members.name: setMultiSelectionEnabled
members.comment: Sets the file chooser to allow multiple file selections.

values.name: escription
values.value: Sets multiple file selection mode.

param: b - true if multiple files may be selected

members.name: isMultiSelectionEnabled
members.comment: Returns true if multiple files can be selected.

return: true if multiple files can be selected

members.name: isFileHidingEnabled
members.comment: Returns true if hidden files are not shown in the file chooser; otherwise, returns false.

return: the status of the file hiding property

members.name: setFileHidingEnabled
members.comment: Sets file hiding on or off. If true, hidden files are not shown in the file chooser. The job of determining which files are shown is done by the FileView.

values.name: escription
values.value: Sets file hiding on or off.

param: b - the boolean value that determines whether file hiding is turned on

members.name: setFileFilter
members.comment: Sets the current file filter. The file filter is used by the file chooser to filter out files from the user's view.

values.name: escription
values.value: Sets the File Filter used to filter out files of type.

param: filter - the new current file filter to use

members.name: getFileFilter
members.comment: Returns the currently selected file filter.

return: the current file filter

members.name: setFileView
members.comment: Sets the file view to be used to retrieve UI information, such as the icon that represents a file or the type description of a file.

values.name: escription
values.value: Sets the File View used to get file type information.

param: fileView - a FileView to be used to retrieve UI information

members.name: getFileView
members.comment: Returns the current file view.

return: the current file view

members.name: getName
members.comment: Returns the filename.

param: f - the File
return: the String containing the filename for f

members.name: getDescription
members.comment: Returns the file description.

param: f - the File
return: the String containing the file description for f

members.name: getTypeDescription
members.comment: Returns the file type.

param: f - the File
return: the String containing the file type description for f

members.name: getIcon
members.comment: Returns the icon for this file or type of file, depending on the system.

param: f - the File
return: the Icon for this file, or type of file

members.name: isTraversable
members.comment: Returns true if the file (directory) can be visited. Returns false if the directory cannot be traversed.

param: f - the File
return: true if the file/directory can be traversed, otherwise false

members.name: accept
members.comment: Returns true if the file should be displayed.

param: f - the File
return: true if the file should be displayed, otherwise false

members.name: setFileSystemView
members.comment: Sets the file system view that the JFileChooser uses for accessing and creating file system resources, such as finding the floppy drive and getting a list of root drives.

values.name: escription
values.value: Sets the FileSytemView used to get filesystem information.

param: fsv - the new FileSystemView

members.name: getFileSystemView
members.comment: Returns the file system view.

return: the FileSystemView object

members.name: approveSelection
members.comment: Called by the UI when the user hits the Approve button (labeled "Open" or "Save", by default). This can also be called by the programmer. This method causes an action event to fire with the command string equal to APPROVE_SELECTION.

members.name: cancelSelection
members.comment: Called by the UI when the user chooses the Cancel button. This can also be called by the programmer. This method causes an action event to fire with the command string equal to CANCEL_SELECTION.

members.name: addActionListener
members.comment: Adds an ActionListener to the file chooser.

param: l - the listener to be added

members.name: removeActionListener
members.comment: Removes an ActionListener from the file chooser.

param: l - the listener to be removed

members.name: getActionListeners
members.comment: Returns an array of all the action listeners registered on this file chooser.

return: all of this file chooser's ActionListeners or an empty array if no action listeners are currently registered

members.name: fireActionPerformed
members.comment: Notifies all listeners that have registered interest for notification on this event type. The event instance is lazily created using the command parameter.

param: command - a string that may specify a command associated with the event

members.name: updateUI
members.comment: Resets the UI property to a value from the current look and feel.

members.name: getUIClassID
members.comment: Returns a string that specifies the name of the L&F class that renders this component.

values.name: escription
values.value: A string that specifies the name of the L&F class.

return: the string "FileChooserUI"

members.name: getUI
members.comment: Gets the UI object which implements the L&F for this component.

return: the FileChooserUI object that implements the FileChooserUI L&F

members.name: paramString
members.comment: Returns a string representation of this JFileChooser. This method is intended to be used only for debugging purposes, and the content and format of the returned string may vary between implementations. The returned string may be empty but may not be null.

return: a string representation of this JFileChooser

members.name: getAccessibleContext
members.comment: Gets the AccessibleContext associated with this JFileChooser. For file choosers, the AccessibleContext takes the form of an AccessibleJFileChooser. A new AccessibleJFileChooser instance is created if necessary.

return: an AccessibleJFileChooser that serves as the AccessibleContext of this JFileChooser

members.comment: Constructs a JFileChooser pointing to the user's default directory. This default depends on the operating system. It is typically the "My Documents" folder on Windows, and the user's home directory on Unix.

Constructs a JFileChooser using the given path. Passing in a null string causes the file chooser to point to the user's default directory. This default depends on the operating system. It is typically the "My Documents" folder on Windows, and the user's home directory on Unix.

param: currentDirectoryPath - a String giving the path to a file or directory

members.comment: Constructs a JFileChooser using the given File as the path. Passing in a null file causes the file chooser to point to the user's default directory. This default depends on the operating system. It is typically the "My Documents" folder on Windows, and the user's home directory on Unix.

param: currentDirectory - a File object specifying the path to a file or directory

members.comment: Constructs a JFileChooser using the given FileSystemView.

param: fsv - a FileSystemView

members.comment: Constructs a JFileChooser using the given current directory and FileSystemView.

param: currentDirectory - a File object specifying the path to a file or directory
fsv - a FileSystemView

members.comment: Constructs a JFileChooser using the given current directory path and FileSystemView.

param: currentDirectoryPath - a String specifying the path to a file or directory
fsv - a FileSystemView

values.name: efaultProperty
values.value: UI

values.name: escription
values.value: A component which allows for the interactive selection of a file.
